page.title: 13SILK SCREEN PRINTING
page.content: The David Evans silk screen printers in Crayford is a famous factory founded in 1825. The silk that the factory uses comes from China where they breed silk worms to produce the raw silk. Originally, the silk printing was done using blocks but now it is done using screen printing. The factory can cover over two hundred metres of silk a day using this method. The factory has its own studio for designing patterns, but most of them are from the original printing blocks. The factory employs 130 workers. 70% of their silk is exported and most of it goes to the U.S.A. The firm also supplies such famous names as Harrods, Liberty and Jacqumar. They have a mill shop on site which can be visited.
